intro: Ranunculus variifolius, commonly known as the variable leaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with numerous petals and a distinctive central yellow stamen. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, deeply lobed leaves. Its foliage is often variable in shape, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
